findings.detail:
Use environment variables or secret management:
✅ GOOD: password = os.getenv('DB_PASSWORD')
✅ GOOD: Use Azure Key Vault, AWS Secrets Manager
❌ BAD: password = 'hardcoded_secret'

Use environment variables or secret management:
✅ GOOD: password = os.getenv('DB_PASSWORD')
✅ GOOD: Use Azure Key Vault, AWS Secrets Manager
❌ BAD: password = 'hardcoded_secret'

findings.message: [Hardcoded Password Detection] Common weak password detected: 'admin123'
findings.detail:
Never use common passwords. Use strong, unique passwords:
✅ GOOD: Generated password from password manager
✅ GOOD: Environment variable with secure value
❌ BAD: password = 'admin123' (easily guessed)

Use environment variables or secret management:
✅ GOOD: password = os.getenv('DB_PASSWORD')
✅ GOOD: Use Azure Key Vault, AWS Secrets Manager
❌ BAD: password = 'hardcoded_secret'

findings.message: [Secrets Detection] Hardcoded secret detected: Stripe Secret Key
findings.detail:
Move Stripe Secret Key to environment variables:
✅ GOOD: api_key = os.getenv('API_KEY')
✅ GOOD: Use secret management (AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault)
❌ BAD: api_key = 'sk_l...mnop' (hardcoded)

findings.message: [SQL Injection Detection] Potential SQL injection: f-string interpolation in SQL query
findings.detail:
Use parameterized queries instead:
✅ GOOD: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?', (user_id,))
✅ GOOD: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = :id', {'id': user_id})
❌ BAD: f'SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_id}'
findings.code: query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = '{user_id}'"

findings.message: [Hardcoded Password Detection] Common weak password detected: 'admin123'
findings.detail:
Never use common passwords. Use strong, unique passwords:
✅ GOOD: Generated password from password manager
✅ GOOD: Environment variable with secure value
❌ BAD: password = 'admin123' (easily guessed)

findings.message: [Taint Analysis] Unsanitized data flow: request.args.get (line 35) -> render_template_string [HTML-content] (line 38)
findings.detail: Sanitize the tainted value before passing to render_template_string.

findings.message: [Taint Analysis] Unsanitized data flow: request.args.get (line 43) -> open [FILE-path] (line 45)
findings.detail: Sanitize the tainted value before passing to open.

Never use common passwords. Use strong, unique passwords:

findings.message: [Secrets Detection] Hardcoded secret detected: Stripe Secret Key
findings.detail:
Move Stripe Secret Key to environment variables:
✅ GOOD: api_key = os.getenv('API_KEY')
✅ GOOD: Use secret management (AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault)
❌ BAD: api_key = 'sk_l...mnop' (hardcoded)

findings.message: [SQL Injection Detection] Potential SQL injection: f-string interpolation in SQL query
findings.detail:
Use parameterized queries instead:
✅ GOOD: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?', (user_id,))
✅ GOOD: cursor.execute('SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = :id', {'id': user_id})
❌ BAD: f'SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {user_id}'
findings.code: query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = '{user_id}'"
